definition: to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

sentences.english: Mr Wei rushed to Taipei during his rest day on a Sunday to see Mr Zhang.
sentences.chinese: 魏姓同学便利用星期日赶到台北和张先生见面。

sentences.english: At that night, Guan Yue flied to Beijing to fetch the bill of lading.
sentences.chinese: 当晚，关跃就乘飞机赶到北京拿回取货单。

sentences.english: When the fire engines arrived the ladders reached only to the sixth floor.
sentences.chinese: 当消防车赶到，云梯车只能达到到六楼。

sentences.english: She went post-haste to the bank and cashed the check .
sentences.chinese: 她急忙赶到银行，把支票兑换成现金。

sentences.english: Can we get there in time.If we hurry?
sentences.chinese: 快点的话我们还能按时赶到吗？

sentences.english: Let's cut through the woods and get ahead of them.
sentences.chinese: 咱们穿过树林抄近路赶到他们前面去。

sentences.english: Sarah and Tom arrived this morning with little Tessie .
sentences.chinese: 今早莎拉和汤姆带着小泰西也赶到了。

sentences.english: Again lead in a short while, search a the seeing of section city criminal police to also arrive to.
sentences.chinese: 又过了一会儿，搜查一科的见城刑警也赶到了。

sentences.english: I just managed to get there in time.
sentences.chinese: 我好容易及时赶到那里。

sentences.english: I hurry to the ticket office.
Hareton, drive those dozen sheep into the barn porch.
sentences.chinese: 海尔顿，把这些样都赶到谷仓前的门廊去。

sentences.english: My horse is dead beat , and I can't get him no further than the stable.
sentences.chinese: 我的马太累了，我不能把它赶到比马房更远的地方。

sentences.english: When Lincoln and Sucre arrive at the pier, Gretchen and Self are gone.
sentences.chinese: 林肯和苏克雷赶到码头，格雷琴和赛尔夫已经离开了。

sentences.english: By the time we got there, it was already getting dark.
sentences.chinese: 等我们赶到那里时，天已经黑下来了。

sentences.english: GOATHERD hmarketing ci ampaign sought to recredined a stray goat to his flock.
sentences.chinese: 很多山羊被牧羊人赶到羊圈里。

sentences.english: Hardly had the leopard cat been scared away when the tiger heard the roar and came.
sentences.chinese: 驱刚刚被虎啸吓跑，可是老虎却闻声赶到了。

definition: at top speed/at a tremendous lick
that very night/through the night/for several nights in a row
to send or deliver to the hospital
to overtake/to catch up with/to hurry/to rush/to try to catch (the bus etc)/to drive (cattle etc) forward/to drive (sb) away/to avail oneself of (an opportunity)/until
to find out/to know/to learn about
